N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-9.3 - Computation of base percentages, current percentages, and current base proportions

State Regulations

The legislative body of each special assessing unit shall
compute base percentages, current percentages and current base proportions for
each class and for each portion class as provided herein. (a) Base percentage. The base percentage for
each class and for each portion class shall be determined pursuant to section
1803-a
of the Real Property Tax Law, provided that the estimated market value of each class or portion class is
adjusted to account for any change in the class designation of parcels. The
estimated class market value shall be adjusted in the following manner: (1)

Determine the decrease in taxable
assessed value in the class or portion class for parcels being removed from the
class due to a change in class designation between the 1989 and 1990 assessment
rolls. (2)

Determine the increase
in taxable assessed value in the class or portion class for parcels being added
to the class due to a change in class designation between the 1989 and 1990
assessment rolls. (3)

Divide the
increase in taxable assessed value determined in paragraph (2) of this
subdivision by the special assessing unit class change in level of assessment
factor between the 1989 and 1990 assessment rolls. (4)

Subtract the decrease in taxable assessed
value for the class determined in paragraph (1) of this subdivision from the
quotient obtained in paragraph (3) of this subdivision. (5)

Divide the difference obtained in
paragraph (4) of this subdivision by the 1989 taxable assessed value of the
class or portion class. Add one to the quotient to determine a class market
value adjustment factor. (6)

Multiply the class or portion class market value obtained pursuant to section
1803-a (2)(a)(1)
of the

Real Property Tax Law by the appropriate class market value adjustment factor
obtained in paragraph (5) of this subdivision. (b) Current percentages. The current
percentage for each class and for each portion class shall be determined
pursuant to section
1803-a
of the Real Property Tax

Law. (c) Current base proportion. The current base proportion for each class and for each portion class shall be
determined pursuant to section
1803-a
of the Real Property Tax Law, provided that the sum of the current base proportions must equal one and each
current base proportion must be expressed as a percentage to at least four
places to the right of the decimal point. Notes
